trans-unit.source: Creating an Azure project with Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Creating an Azure project with Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Creating an Azure project with Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Creating an Azure project with Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Creating an Azure Project with Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Creating an Azure Project with Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: The Azure Tools for Visual Studio provide a template that lets you create a cloud service for Azure.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Tools for Visual Studio provide a template that lets you create a cloud service for Azure.

trans-unit.source: The tools also help you configure, debug, and deploy the cloud service to Azure.
trans-unit.target: The tools also help you configure, debug, and deploy the cloud service to Azure.

trans-unit.source: An Azure cloud service solution contains the following types of projects:
trans-unit.target: An Azure cloud service solution contains the following types of projects:

trans-unit.source: Azure project
trans-unit.target: Azure project

trans-unit.source: The Azure project has associations to the role projects in the solution.
trans-unit.target: The Azure project has associations to the role projects in the solution.

trans-unit.source: It also includes the service definition and service configuration files.
trans-unit.target: It also includes the service definition and service configuration files.

trans-unit.source: The service definition file defines the runtime settings for your application including what roles are required, endpoints, and virtual machine size.
trans-unit.target: The service definition file defines the runtime settings for your application including what roles are required, endpoints, and virtual machine size.

trans-unit.source: The service configuration file configures how many instances of a role are run and the values of the settings defined for a role.
trans-unit.target: The service configuration file configures how many instances of a role are run and the values of the settings defined for a role.

trans-unit.source: For more information about these settings, see [How to: Configure the Roles for an Azure Cloud Service with Visual Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh369931.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information about these settings, see [How to: Configure the Roles for an Azure Cloud Service with Visual Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh369931.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Web role project
trans-unit.target: Web role project

trans-unit.source: A worker role performs background processing.
trans-unit.target: A worker role performs background processing.

trans-unit.source: A worker role can communicate with storage services and with other Internet-based services.
trans-unit.target: A worker role can communicate with storage services and with other Internet-based services.

trans-unit.source: A worker role can have any number of HTTP, HTTPS, or TCP endpoints.
trans-unit.target: A worker role can have any number of HTTP, HTTPS, or TCP endpoints.

trans-unit.source: **ASP.NET Web Role**, for building an ASP.NET application with a web front end
trans-unit.target: **ASP.NET Web Role**, for building an ASP.NET application with a web front end

trans-unit.source: ASP.NET MVC5 Web Role
trans-unit.target: ASP.NET MVC5 Web Role

trans-unit.source: ASP.NET MVC4 Web Role
trans-unit.target: ASP.NET MVC4 Web Role

trans-unit.source: ASP.NET MVC3 Web Role
trans-unit.target: ASP.NET MVC3 Web Role

trans-unit.source: **WCF Service Web Role**, for building a WCF service
trans-unit.target: **WCF Service Web Role**, for building a WCF service

trans-unit.source: **Silverlight Business Application Web Role** (requires Visual Studio 2012)
trans-unit.target: **Silverlight Business Application Web Role** (requires Visual Studio 2012)

trans-unit.source: Cache Worker Role
trans-unit.target: Cache Worker Role

trans-unit.source: A role that provides a dedicated cache to your application.
trans-unit.target: A role that provides a dedicated cache to your application.

trans-unit.source: Worker Role with Service Bus Queue
trans-unit.target: Worker Role with Service Bus Queue

trans-unit.source: A service bus queue that provides message queuing functionality to communicate with the worker process.
trans-unit.target: A service bus queue that provides message queuing functionality to communicate with the worker process.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to Use Service Bus Queues](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=260560).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to Use Service Bus Queues](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=260560).

trans-unit.source: To create an Azure cloud service project in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: To create an Azure cloud service project in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Start Microsoft Visual Studio as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Start Microsoft Visual Studio as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: On the menu bar, choose **File**, **New**, **Project**.
trans-unit.target: On the menu bar, choose **File**, **New**, **Project**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Project Types** pane, choose **Cloud** from the Visual C# or Visual Basic project template nodes.
trans-unit.target: In the **Project Types** pane, choose **Cloud** from the Visual C# or Visual Basic project template nodes.

trans-unit.source: In the **Templates** pane, choose **Azure Cloud Service**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Templates** pane, choose **Azure Cloud Service**.

trans-unit.source: Specify which version of the .NET Framework you want to use to develop your project.
trans-unit.target: Specify which version of the .NET Framework you want to use to develop your project.

trans-unit.source: Enter a name and location for your project and a name for the solution.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name and location for your project and a name for the solution.

trans-unit.source: Choose the **OK** button.
trans-unit.target: Choose the **OK** button.

trans-unit.source: In the **New Azure Project** dialog box, choose the roles that you want to add, and choose the right arrow button to add them to your solution.
trans-unit.target: In the **New Azure Project** dialog box, choose the roles that you want to add, and choose the right arrow button to add them to your solution.

trans-unit.source: You can add as many roles as you need.
trans-unit.target: You can add as many roles as you need.

trans-unit.source: To rename a role that you've added to your project, hover on the role in the **New Azure Project** dialog box, and choose the **Rename** icon to the right of the role.
trans-unit.target: To rename a role that you've added to your project, hover on the role in the **New Azure Project** dialog box, and choose the **Rename** icon to the right of the role.

trans-unit.source: You can also rename a role within your solution after it has been added.
trans-unit.target: You can also rename a role within your solution after it has been added.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
